intro: Satureja vardarensis, commonly known as the Balkan savory, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in temperate climates. Satureja vardarensis is valued for its aromatic properties and has been used traditionally in local cuisines and herbal remedies.
